name: reimpose
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
to officially force a rule, tax, punishment, etc. to be obeyed or received again after a period when it was not used: She plans to reimpose regulations on energy corporations. The curfew had been lifted on Friday but it was reimposed on Monday.
to force someone to accept something, especially a belief or way of living, again: The new regime wants to reimpose the traditional values of hard work and respect. The police had to step in to reimpose order. Related words
impose
reimposition
More examplesFewer examplesThe government is likely to re-impose the tax on petrol. The government needs to reimpose controls on how much the banks can lend.The referee was forced to reimpose his authority by booking four players.
